title: Tamaulipas Seizures of $(USD)10,000+
name: Tamaulipas Seizures of $(USD)10,000+
description: This data presents seizures of $(USD)10,000 or more in Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.operation information: US Customs officials were involved in the operation.
properties.event summary: 09/17/2011: On Saturday, at a border checkpoint in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico, United States Customs officials searched a Mexican citizen identified as Maria de Jesus Lopez Parra. She was discovered to have 51,609 USD, five Canadian dollars, one Guatemalan quetzal and 1,360 MXN. The currency was found concealed inside two boxes of DVDs.
properties.event title: Over Fifty Thousand Dollars Seized at Nuevo Laredo Checkpoint

properties.operation information: Mexican customs officials were involved in the operation.
properties.event summary: 09/17/2011: On Saturday, in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico, customs officials arrested Sara Balderas Reyes. The suspect was detained after officials discovered $54,300 hidden in a video recorder in her luggage.
properties.event title: Woman Arrested and $54,300 Seized at Checkpoint in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico

properties.operation information: The Mexican Military of the 8/a. military zone conducted the military operation.
properties.event summary: 12/08/2011: On Thursday, in Reynosa and Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico, the Secretary of National Defense reported, in the 8/a. military zone, in different events, that the following was seized by the military: one suspect was arrested, 1,047 packets of marijuana, weighing 4,314 kilograms, $50,000 USD, four rifles, 69 magazines, 2,038 bullets of different calibers, a vehicle, three antennas, two voltage regulated sources, three repeaters (for computers), and two duplexes (for computers). The detainee was handed over to the proper authorities along with the seized items.
properties.event title: Military Seized More Than Four Tons of Marijuana and $50,000 USD in Reynosa and Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico
